com.kdgregory.kdgcommons.buffer

Class BufferUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kdgregory.kdgcommons.buffer.BufferUtil

  • public class BufferUtil
extends Object
    Static utility methods for working with NIO buffers.

    These methods are not thread-safe unless explicityly marked as such.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static char[] getChars(ByteBuffer buf, int off, int count)
      Returns a character array from the buffer.
      static String getUTF8String(ByteBuffer buf, int off, int len)
      Extracts a specified sequence of bytes from a buffer and converts it to a Java String using UTF-8 encoding.
      static MappedByteBuffer map(File file, long offset, long length, FileChannel.MapMode mode)
      Memory maps a segment of a file.
      static byte[] toArray(ByteBuffer buf)
      Creates and fills a byte array that consists of all bytes from 0 to the buffer's limit.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • map

        public static MappedByteBuffer map(File file,
                                   long offset,
                                   long length,
                                   FileChannel.MapMode mode)
                            throws IOException
        Memory maps a segment of a file.

        This method is thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to be mapped.
        offset - The starting location of the mapping within the file.
        length - The number of bytes to be mapped. This is limited to Integer.MAX_VALUE, but is a long so that you can pass File.length().
        mode - The mapping mode. The underlying channel will be opened using the same mode (so that you can map a read-only file).
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getUTF8String

        public static String getUTF8String(ByteBuffer buf,
                                   int off,
                                   int len)
        Extracts a specified sequence of bytes from a buffer and converts it to a Java String using UTF-8 encoding.
        Parameters:
        buf - The buffer
        off - Offset within the buffer where the string starts
        len - Number of bytes to be converted; caller is responsible for ensuring that the buffer has those bytes available

      • getChars

        public static char[] getChars(ByteBuffer buf,
                              int off,
                              int count)
        Returns a character array from the buffer. This method is equivalent to repeatedly calling getChar().
        Parameters:
        buf - The buffer
        off - Offset within the buffer where conversion will start
        count - The number of characters to retrieve (unlike other methods, which specify the number of bytes)

      • toArray

        public static byte[] toArray(ByteBuffer buf)
        Creates and fills a byte array that consists of all bytes from 0 to the buffer's limit. This array is independent of the buffer's backing array (if any)
        Since:
        1.0.15
